visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts timeline chart with the title 'Timeline of Space Exploration'. The chart should have invisible x and y axes. The data series should include events such as 'First dogs in space', 'Sputnik 1', 'First human spaceflight', and 'First human on the Moon'. Each event should have a name, label, and description. The data labels should have a silver connector with a width of 2. The chart should have a subtitle linking to the Wikipedia page for the timeline of space exploration.

data.name: First dogs
data.label: 1951: First dogs in space
data.description: 22 July 1951 First dogs in space (Dezik and Tsygan)

data.name: Sputnik 1
data.label: 1957: First artificial satellite
data.description: 4 October 1957 First artificial satellite. First signals from space.

data.name: First human spaceflight
data.label: 1961: First human spaceflight (Yuri Gagarin)
data.description: First human spaceflight (Yuri Gagarin), and the first human-crewed orbital flight

data.name: First human on the Moon
data.label: 1969: First human on the Moon
data.description: First human on the Moon, and first space launch from a celestial body other than the Earth. First sample return from the Moon

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a timeline chart titled 'Timeline of Space Exploration'. The chart type is set to 'timeline', and both the x and y axes are set to be invisible. The title of the chart is styled with the specified text, and a subtitle is included with a link to the Wikipedia page for the timeline of space exploration. The data series includes four significant events in space exploration history, each with a name, label, and description. The data labels are styled with a silver connector of width 2, providing a clear visual connection between the labels and the data points. This configuration effectively visualizes the timeline of key events in space exploration.
